name: clubbable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
friendly and sociable (= enjoying meeting other people and spending time with them), in a way that makes you a suitable member of a club, especially one that people of a high social class belong to: He was not, in the conventional sense, a clubbable man. Crime writers are pretty clubbable on the whole.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was the most clubbable of men and was loved by his many friends.In just a decade, the bank has gone from a friendly, clubbable institution to one of the biggest banks in the world.He was described by those who worked with him as immensely clubbable, but also driven and ambitious.
